meanings.definition: Plants that grow beneath other plants.
meanings.sent1: The underplants received less sunlight due to the taller plants above.
meanings.sent2: I noticed some underplants growing under the big tree in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The underplants played hide-and-seek with the sun, peeking out occasionally.
meanings.sent4: The underplants were like secret agents, hidden from view by the larger plants.
meanings.sent5: The underplants added a layer of mystery and beauty to the garden.

meanings.sent1: She carefully underplants the new flowers to protect them from the harsh sun.
meanings.sent2: Remember to underplants the fertilizer to ensure it reaches the roots.
meanings.sent3: He underplants the seeds like buried treasure, waiting for them to sprout.
meanings.sent4: The gardener underplants the mulch to keep the soil moist and cool.
meanings.sent5: Underplanting the bulbs guarantees a colorful display in the spring.

meanings.definition: The act of planting something beneath other plants.
meanings.sent1: The underplants of daffodils created a beautiful contrast with the taller flowers.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite gardening task is the underplants of new herbs in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The underplants of tiny succulents looked like a hidden miniature forest.
meanings.sent4: The underplants of wildflowers brought a burst of color to the shaded area.
meanings.sent5: The underplants of ferns added a lush green carpet under the trees.
